results.title: Fashioning a Future in the Face of War
results.abstract: A year after Russia began its invasion of Ukraine, four figures from the Kyiv fashion scene reflect on a year of personal and professional survival.

results.title: Is This Fashion’s Most Knocked-Off Shoe Design?
results.abstract: René Caovilla stilettos with the distinctive strap snaking up the ankle are celebrating 50 years of style.

multimedia.caption: In 1973 René Caovilla introduced the Cleo, with its sinuous strap, and the sandal has continued to be a favorite ever since. Here it was on the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival in 2022.
In 1973 René Caovilla introduced the Cleo, with its sinuous strap, and the sandal has continued to be a favorite ever since. Here it was on the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival in 2022.

results.title: Farewell to Vivienne Westwood, Fashion’s Rebel With a Cause
results.abstract: The great and the good of the industry gathered for a memorial service in London to honor the British designer, who died in December.

multimedia.caption: Vivienne Westwood, who died in December, was remembered as “a genius,” “a true feminist” and a “lover of women” by one of her many celebrity devotees at a memorial service held steps from the River Thames on Thursday.

Vivienne Westwood, who died in December, was remembered as “a genius,” “a true feminist” and a “lover of women” by one of her many celebrity devotees at a memorial service held steps from the River Thames on Thursday.

results.title: You Don’t Have to Be a Skier to Dress Like One (From the ’80s)
results.abstract: Neon and metallic designs have become so popular among skiers and nonskiers seeking “the vibe” that they’ve become hard to find.

results.title: Punk Is What You Make It
results.abstract: The style looms large on the streets of London, where it is expressed in myriad ways.

multimedia.caption: On their own, each of her accessories could be described as elegant. But all together, they look opulent.

results.title: Anne Imhof, Dancing in the Ruins
results.abstract: The German provocateur’s opening in Los Angeles shows her choreographic skills and obsession with youthful nihilism. But when the performers leave, the emptiness remains.

multimedia.caption: From left, Ruben Noel and Jakob Eilinghoff in the opening performance of Anne Imhof’s exhibition “Emo” at Sprüth Magers, which featured a “crashed” pickup truck.

results.title: Have You Clocked These Boots?
results.abstract: Every so often, a specific boot gets associated with a certain era. Will Blundstone’s Chelsea boots be the defining style of the early 2020s?

multimedia.caption: Blundstone’s Chelsea boots can be identified by logos subtly embossed on their soles and embroidered on their pull-on straps.
Blundstone’s Chelsea boots can be identified by logos subtly embossed on their soles and embroidered on their pull-on straps.

results.title: Tennis Bracelet, Anyone?
results.abstract: Chris Evert made them famous, and their simple, elegant designs have stood the test of time.

multimedia.caption: “I remember my mom having a tennis bracelet, and I remember she wore that with her watch and that’s what she wore,” said Monica Rich Kosann, who designed this sapphire tennis bracelet, which ranges from $2,595 to $2,715. “Whereas now, my daughters, they wear it every day.”

“I remember my mom having a tennis bracelet, and I remember she wore that with her watch and that’s what she wore,” said Monica Rich Kosann, who designed this sapphire tennis bracelet, which ranges from $2,595 to $2,715. “Whereas now, my daughters, they wear it every day.”

results.title: Joan Mitchell Foundation Claims Vuitton Ads Infringe on Painter’s Copyright
results.abstract: The artist’s organization said it rejected requests from the fashion company to use the artworks in handbag ads, but the luxury brand used them anyway.

results.title: Erotic Watches Show More Than the Time
results.abstract: Brands like Ulysse Nardin and Blancpain say their risqué timepieces showcase specialty skills like enameling, engraving and micropainting.

multimedia.caption: Nathalie Marielloni, vice curator at the Musée International d’Horlogerie in La Chaux-de-Fonds, Switzerland, said the heyday for saucy watches started with 18th-century pocket watches.
multimedia.copyright: Clara Tuma for The New York Times

results.title: A Man Hanging From a Clock. Yes, It’s That Silent Film.
results.abstract: “Safety Last!,” the 1923 Harold Lloyd movie best known for the dangerous scene, marks its centennial.

multimedia.caption: Harold Lloyd in the 1923 movie “Safety Last!” A safety net was constructed on a roof about one floor below the action, though the scene was shot to look as though there was a sheer drop to the bustling streets far below.

Harold Lloyd in the 1923 movie “Safety Last!” A safety net was constructed on a roof about one floor below the action, though the scene was shot to look as though there was a sheer drop to the bustling streets far below.

results.title: Swiss Watchmaker Is Living His Dream
results.abstract: Hervé Schlüchter now has his own atelier, new designs and plans for the future.

multimedia.caption: Mr. Schlüchter decided to found his atelier after his father died and his first son was born. “This was a huge emotional moment, and I realized that I wanted to change my life,” he said.
multimedia.copyright: Anders Modig for The New York Times

results.title: Montblanc Plans to Capitalize on a Popular New Design
results.abstract: The brand has struggled to be seen as a watchmaker, but its recent 1858 Iced Sea line seems to have struck a chord with customers.

multimedia.caption: Montblanc’s managing director of its watch division, Laurent Lecamp, left, and Nicolas Baretzki, the company’s chief executive. “We are not looking for customers,” Mr. Lecamp said, “we’re looking for fans.”
multimedia.copyright: Dmitry Kostyukov for The New York Times

results.title: Cartier’s Tank Française Watch Gets a Makeover
results.abstract: Experts credit Meghan Markle’s fondness for the feminine timepiece as one reason it has legions of fans. Its new look aims for a gender-crossing appeal.

multimedia.caption: A yellow-gold Tank Française watch that once belonged to Princess Diana was reportedly passed down to Prince Harry, whose wife, Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, has worn it regularly in recent years.

results.title: Vintage Is the Focus of a New Watch Line
results.abstract: Jaeger-LeCoultre has introduced the Collectibles, a selection of 17 models for resale (when it can find pieces in good condition).
